intro: Leucanthemum fissum, commonly known as the European oxeye daisy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features a basal rosette of narrow, silver-gray leaves and produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils. Leucanthemum fissum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides.
